title: Markdown support: issue with dragging folder into editor to create a link on Linux edition of VSCode
description:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: 1.97.2 (latest)
- OS Version: Ubuntu/Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open an `.md` file
2. Drag a folder from the left hand File Explorer and drop it into the editor while holding the SHIFT key down
3. Using the Microsoft Windows version of VSCode this action will result in the creation of a markdown style relative link in the editor **as expected**, e.g.:

```
[text](../../../folder_name)
```

4. Using the `.deb` file installed release of VSCode on Ubuntu Desktop or Linux Mint desktop, the same action results in the absolute path to the folder being pasted into the editor, e.g.:

```
/home/my_user/Documents/gitlab/doc/content/en/some/path/folder_name
```

I feel that the behaviour in the Linux distros is **incorrect and is a bug** and a markdown style link should be created instead.

I do not have any extensions installed in VSCode and all settings are in their default state (I have not changed any).

Note that I can drag an `.md` file or an image type file (`.png`, `.jpg` etc.) from a folder in the left hand explorer and drop it into the editor and on both Linux and Windows a markdown link will be created **as expected** with the relative path to the file - so I know the drag and drop facility is working as designed.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Add a keybinding for `git.diff.stageHunk`.
2. Open a project with unstaged changes.
3. Click on "Open changes".
4. Place the cursor on the hunk you want to stage.
6. Use the keybinding to stage the hunk.

Expected:
The hunk gets staged.

Actual:
The changes remain unstaged.

title: The `console: internalConsole` is ineffective for `electron.cmd`, BUT works for other file names
description:
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes - VS Code version: Code 1.97.2 (e54c774e0add60467559eb0d1e229c6452cf8447, 2025-02-12T23:20:35.343Z) - OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.26100

webnn: disabled_off| |Load (avg)|undefined| |Memory (System)|4.00GB (1.68GB free)| |Process Argv|--disable-extensions --crash-reporter-id fd890125-9092-4d18-a61f-dd531a5fba5e| |Screen Reader|no| |VM|0%|
## Issue Description I was following the [Electron - Building your First App](https://www.electronjs.org/docs/latest/tutorial/tutorial-first-app#optional-debugging-from-vs-code) guide to create a simple Electron app, added a debugging configuration, but was unable to run it in VSCode. It reported that it couldn't find the Node.js installed via fnm. I can easily fix this issue by adding Node.js to the PATH, but during my investigation, I discovered a very confusing phenomenon: This issue only occurs when targeting `"runtimeExecutable": "${workspaceFolder}/node_modules/.bin/electron.cmd"`. If I rename the file, everything works fine. My experiments confirm that the `console: internalConsole` option works for files other than `electron.cmd` because it prints out a PATH that includes fnm-generated entries, proving that the PowerShell profile script was executed. And after removing this line, the previously working launch task now also reports that Node.js cannot be found. However, when targeting `electron.cmd`, the printed PATH only contains the system-configured values, without the dynamically generated profile entries. ## Steps to Reproduce I can reproduce this behavior on a freshly installed Windows system: 1. Download and install VSCode and fnm, then run `fnm install 22` 2. Complete fnm’s [shell integration setup](https://github.com/Schniz/fnm?tab=readme-ov-file#powershell) ```powershell if (-not (Test-Path $profile)) { New-Item $profile -Force } echo "fnm env --use-on-cd --shell powershell | Out-String | Invoke-Expression" >> $profile ``` 3. Verify system environment variables—Node.js should not be in PATH, but fnm should be: ```powershell $ $env:PATH C:\Users\\AppData\Local\fnm_multishells\17496_1739626282534;C:\Program Files\PowerShell\7; ``` 4. Clone the example repo, install dependencies, and add the tutorial's launch configuration with `integratedTerminal` set: ```powershell git clone https://github.com/electron/electron-quick-start.git cd electron-quick-start npm install mkdir .vscode touch .vscode/launch.json ``` ```json { "version": "0.2.0", "configurations": [ { "name": "Main", "type": "node", "request": "launch", "cwd": "${workspaceFolder}", "runtimeExecutable": "${workspaceFolder}/node_modules/.bin/electron", "windows": { "runtimeExecutable": "${workspaceFolder}/node_modules/.bin/electron.cmd" }, "args": [".", "--remote-debugging-port=9222"], "outputCapture": "std", "console": "integratedTerminal" } ] } ``` 5. Open the folder in VSCode and start debugging `Main`. ## Expected Result An Electron window should launch and debugging should work as expected. ## Actual Result An error popup appears with a "Open 'launch.json'" button in the bottom-right corner: ``` Can't find Node.js binary "\node_modules\.bin\electron.cmd": error getting version: \node_modules\.bin\electron.cmd exited with code 1: '"node"' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file Make sure Node.js is installed and in your PATH, or set the "runtimeExecutable" in your launch.json ``` --- The most frustrating part is that this issue only affects `node_modules\.bin\electron.cmd`. If I copy the file and change nothing else, it works fine: ```powershell $ cp node_modules\.bin\electron.cmd node_modules\.bin\electron2.cmd $ (Get-Content .vscode\launch.json) -replace 'electron\.cmd', 'electron2.cmd' | Out-File -Encoding UTF8 output.json $ cp output.json .vscode\launch.json ```
`.vscode\launch.json` after edit ```json { "version": "0.2.0", "configurations": [ { "name": "Main", "type": "node", "request": "launch", "cwd": "${workspaceFolder}", "runtimeExecutable": "${workspaceFolder}/node_modules/.bin/electron", "windows": { "runtimeExecutable": "${workspaceFolder}/node_modules/.bin/electron2.cmd" }, "args": [".", "--remote-debugging-port=9222"], "outputCapture": "std", "console": "integratedTerminal" } ] } ```
Additionally, when pressing F5 to start debugging, VSCode’s integrated terminal pops up and prints some output—this does not happen when using `electron.cmd`: ```powershell ${env:NODE_OPTIONS}=' --require "c:/Users//AppData/Local/Programs/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/extensions/ms-vscode.js-debug/src/bootloader.js" '; ${env:VSCODE_INSPECTOR_OPTIONS}=':::{"inspectorIpc":"\\\\.\\pipe\\node-cdp.8392-dbb2230e-5.sock","deferredMode":false,"waitForDebugger":"","onlyEntrypoint":false,"autoAttachMode":"always","fileCallback":"C:\\Users\\\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\node-debug-callback-551c913f41a77523"}'; & 'C:\Users\\electron-quick-start/node_modules/.bin/electron2.cmd' '.' '--remote-debugging-port=9222' ``` ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/042ec4cc-9b2f-445d-abf3-b6ab363e38a0) ## Related Investigations I found some similar issues: - https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/106537#issuecomment-692781598 Adding `"integratedTerminal"` to other configurations does help, but not for `electron.cmd`. - https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-js-debug/issues/865 Adding Node.js or fnm’s link directly to PATH solves the issue, but it doesn’t feel elegant. ``` [Environment]::SetEnvironmentVariable("Path", "$userPath;C:\Users\\AppData\Roaming\fnm\aliases\default", "User") ``` Is there any hardcode strings handing around? I couldn't classify this issue as related to fnm, Node.js, Electron or any extension, maybe this is related to `internalConsole` settings, so I decided to post it under VSCode.

title: Git diff does not show files with long paths in Source Control View (Windows)
description:
- **VS Code 版本**: 1.97.1
- **操作系统**: Windows 10 
- **Git 版本**: 2.47.1.windows.1

- **问题描述**:
  在 VS Code 的 "源代码管理" 视图（Source Control View）中，点击某一个commit后，`对比`窗口不能正确显示路径过长的文件。  
  但在终端运行 `git diff` 可以看到这些文件的变更。

#### **复现步骤**
1. 创建一个路径超过 219 个字符的文件，并提交到 Git 仓库。
2. 修改该文件。
3. 在 VS Code 的 "源代码管理" 视图中查看变更。
4. 发现该文件未出现在 Git 变更列表中，但终端运行 `git diff` 能正确显示。

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c4b51448-7f01-4eac-9ee3-8dcd11ffd4e6)

#### **预期行为**
- VS Code 应该与 `git diff` 一致，能够正确显示所有被修改的文件。

#### **实际行为**
- 部分路径过长的文件不会显示在 Git 对比（diff）窗口中。

#### **可能的影响范围**
- Windows 用户（默认 `MAX_PATH` 限制 260 字符）

title: System Context Menu is not displayed properly depending on the mouse cursor position
description:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes/No

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: 1.97.2 and 1.98 insiders
- OS Version: Windows 11

Hi,

I tend to use the System Context Menu because sometimes is easier to deal with the window using keyboard, instead of the mouse. But I have noticed that recently, this behavior started to occur. Not sure if there is some setting to change.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Be sure the _sticky scroll_ behavior is ON
2. Open a document which will display the _sticky scroll_
3. Scroll the document until the _sticky scroll_ is visible
4. Put the mouse over the _sticky scroll_
5. Hit <kbd>Alt</kbd> + <kbd>Space</kbd> to open the System Context Menu
6. Instead of the System Context Menu, you will see this menu

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/97bf23ad-795e-4588-bc58-6e1a0f22f6d8)

7. Move the mouse out of the _sticky scroll_, inside the editor text area
8. Hit <kbd>Alt</kbd> + <kbd>Space</kbd> again
9. Now, the System Context Menu appears

You will notice the same erroneous behavior if you the mouse cursor is over the editor title area, or the window title bar.

Thank you

title: Suggestion: add validation for missing properties under `contributes` in `package.json` for a VS Code extension
description:
You can use this repo for reference: https://github.com/mohsen1/llm-debugger-vscode-extension

In `package.json` for this extension, the `icon` properties are missing for `viewContainers` and `views` that it contributes. When you run the extension, you get the following error message:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a5634d8c-f579-4779-9888-55f1b02f201d)

I probably spent an hour trying to "fix" the top level `icon` property in `package.json` to no avail since it wasn't the culprit :).  It wasn't until @isidorn pointed out to me that these contributions also needed an `icon` property. You can see the "fix" here:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ed3bbd15-97ea-4284-992b-8b94f018f78a)

Suggestion: Can we show validation on one or more of the `contributes` properties in the file, similar to how there is validation on `activationEvents` `"*"` that give the user some indication of where the missing properties are?  

Assigning per Isi's recommendation.

title: Wrong encoding of JSON schema URL
description:
Type: Bug I configured a JSON schema in the json.schemas settings element: { "fileMatch": ["associations.config*.json"], "url": "file:///c:/ELOprofessional/config/json-schema/associations.config.schema.json" } This works well. I replaced the "url" paramter with the following: { "fileMatch": ["associations.config*.json"], "url": "https://ikmaster.ovitashu.local:9093/ix-elo/ix?cmd\\=readdoc1&downloadid=(9CF9004A-DC3C-746A-97F5-7960CF3BDE0D)&fname=associations.config.schema.json" } The URL is correct above, I can open it in a browser. However VS cannot open it, I got the following error message in the terminal: Unable to load schema from 'https://ikmaster.ovitashu.local:9093/ix-elo/ix?cmd\=readdoc1&downloadid=(9CF9004A-DC3C-746A-97F5-7960CF3BDE0D)&fname=associations.config.schema.json': Not Found. The requested location could not be found. I checked at the server side and the problem is that VS sends bad URL, it encodes the = and & characters, which is a problem, because these are important separator characters of the GET parameters. This is the URL that VS sends (Tomcat localhost access LOG file): 192.168.190.64 - - [13/Feb/2025:08:21:56 +0100] "GET /ix-elo/ix?cmd%3Dreaddoc1%26downloadid%3D%289CF9004A-DC3C-746A-97F5-7960CF3BDE0D%29%26fname%3Dassociations.config.schema.json HTTP/1.1" 404 121 And this is the how it looks like when I open it from a browser: 192.168.190.64 - - [13/Feb/2025:08:21:44 +0100] "GET /ix-elo/ix?cmd=readdoc1&downloadid=(9CF9004A-DC3C-746A-97F5-7960CF3BDE0D)&fname=associations.config.schema.json HTTP/1.1" 200 79828 So, it seems clearly for me as a bug. Thank you for your help! Kind regards, Csaba D. VS Code version: Code 1.97.1 (e249dada235c2083c83813bd65b7f4707fb97b76, 2025-02-10T13:13:58.153Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.22631 Modes:

title: Editor setting `editor.tabSize` does not apply on empty files after startup
description:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. create a new empty `foo.yml` file and open it
2. notice how in the status bar you can see `Spaces: 2`
3. reload window

🐛 status bar indicates `Spaces: 4`

This is a variant of https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/231224 where it seems that since ESM, certain configuration defaults are not present at the time we create a model. My fix in https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/commit/dccf6bb5eca1d3bf9530436f67c25c462d1634d3 ensures that we pass forward the proper `editor.tabSize` to `updateOptions`, but it seems to be one of the few options we do not support to change ad-hoc here:

https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/093e289792001a7ce53893e5944bc1d9dfb0e11a/src/vs/editor/browser/config/editorConfiguration.ts#L337-L347

Specifically, there is no `editor.tabSize` in [`EditorOption`](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/093e289792001a7ce53893e5944bc1d9dfb0e11a/src/vs/editor/common/config/editorOptions.ts#L5432).

Rather, these seem to be read only when creating the model:

https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/093e289792001a7ce53893e5944bc1d9dfb0e11a/src/vs/editor/common/services/modelService.ts#L122

I am not sure if this can be fixed at all in editor land, thus also assigning @sandy081 to determine if extension config defaults could be resolved sooner, though I would not do that at the price of a slower startup to be fair.

//cc @alexdima

title: Git - SourceGraph does not show origin/master as a reference point
description:
Type: Bug This issue occurs even when all the extensions are disabled (i checked) but I will leave the extension info available. 1. Make a git repo. 2. Make some commits on master 3. checkout a different branch 4. make some commits there 5. open the source control graph and inspect The graph used to show the currently checked out branch's commits for both local and remote, as well as the `remote/master`. This is useful when you want to rebase or pull, because you have an idea about the state of your branch (leading / trailing) as compared to the `master` branch. ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ccd7ec98-d2fe-42e8-a3e8-ea7baef55545) This information is no longer present. title: My Code Insiders build doesn't work well with VS Code Neovim extension
description:
Type: Bug After a while using - it may just be one key press - all keyboard is grabbed and not registered in the editor. I suspect the issue may be with this fix https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/commit/ff39acb25de7a6c261e817f7c3da36bf9ebf7f79 I was trying to use insiders, because of this or similar bug: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/238618 In my case navigating with vim movments up/down (j,k) for a second, takes me up to the first line and starts placing "jjjjjjjjjj" string inside with additional text " om: message" on the top, so it was like "om: message jjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjj" inside the first or second line of the file. title: Cannot Log In to Different Account in Azure
description:
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: No

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: 1.97.1
- OS Version: Windows 11 Enterprise, Version 23H2

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Go to Azure Resource Extension
2. Sign In to Azure
3. Click Allow on the, "The extension 'Azure Resources' wants to sign in using Microsoft" pop-up
4. Sign in pop-up shows work account linked to windows.  I select "Use another account"
5. I enter 2nd work account username
6. I am automatically routed to Microsoft Authenticator for the work account linked to windows

I am not able to sign in using my 2nd work account.  This is important as that is the account with the Azure resources I need.

Resolved by:
1. Going to VS Code settings, searching for microsoft-authentication.implementation
2. Set to "classic"
3. When signing in to Azure, the browser opens and I'm allowed to select my 2nd work account and log into that

NOTE:  I had to change my browser default to Edge as Chrome did the same thing as the issue.


This was NOT a problem a week ago.  I would like to know, 1) why this is happening, and 2) that you PLEASE don't remove the classic authentication method until it is resolved!

title: `IConfigurationChangeEvent.affectsConfiguration` does not support `overrides` properly for default changes
description:
Extracted from https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/231224

At some point after startup, configuration defaults will change from extensions such as `markdown`. Specifically, the markdown extension contributes defaults for a `[markdown]` language override.

The editor listens to config changes, but tries to be clever to not update too often by using:

https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/21525b01bf68bf9250cb856f192628fffc449234/src/vs/workbench/browser/parts/editor/textEditor.ts#L111-L113

This eventually ends up in this method with the override properly set as `markdown`:

https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/21525b01bf68bf9250cb856f192628fffc449234/src/vs/platform/configuration/common/configurationModels.ts#L1200

However, we end up in an early return from here:

https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/21525b01bf68bf9250cb856f192628fffc449234/src/vs/platform/configuration/common/configurationModels.ts#L1207

I conclude, that the configuration event does not properly support `affectsConfiguration` calls with a language override.

Or am I using this method in the wrong way?

title: Jump-scrolling after search
description:
### Applies To

- [x] Notebooks (.ipynb files)
- [ ] Interactive Window and\/or Cell Scripts (.py files with \#%% markers)

### What happened?

After searching for a term und shifting focus to the cell / text field the window position jumps. It's actually pretty annoying :)

I could reproduce the bug in a clean installation of VS Code:
- install Jupyter extension.
- create new .ipynb-file.
- create code cell.
- add random text in with way more lines than window displays, e.g. 200.
- search a term that exists at least 2 times in different sections of the cell (so when going to the next occurrence it needs to scroll).
- click a couple of times the up and down arrow (optimally over the beginning of the findings e.g. from 3/3 to 1/3)
- scroll one click with mouse wheel in the text field / cell up- or downwards.
=> the window jumps way more lines than one mouse wheel click.

The size of jumps changes with text size I assume.

### VS Code Version

latest release and even versions from before 1 year

### Jupyter Extension Version

latest release

### Jupyter logs

```shell

```

### Coding Language and Runtime Version

python 10

### Language Extension Version (if applicable)

_No response_

### Anaconda Version (if applicable)

_No response_

### Running Jupyter locally or remotely?

Local

title: workbench.js “Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'bind')     at workbench.js:404:80180”
description:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes/No

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
VS Code Version: code 1.97.0 
OS Version: windows11 chrome

I executed "code serve-web --without-connection-token --host 0.0.0.0" and then opened "192.168.33.3:8000" in my browser, but the VSCode page did not load. After pressing F12 and debugging, I discovered the following error message:

workbench.js “Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'bind')     at workbench.js:404:80180”

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b3d2bb17-9e33-4aea-85fe-9ae2f2ded717)

title: Can't sign into Azure from VS Code with the new authentication. VPN blocking native auth flow
description:
I need to sign in to Azure from browser for my company VPN to work properly. I was using browser sign-in page until a couple of weeks.

When I needed to login a couple of days ago I tried as usual but VSCode now opens azure login in a internal view / internal window. I can't sign into my company VPN account this way.

I believe this is because of the new Microsoft authentication method.

Using Azure CLI in a terminal to login doesn't integrate with the azure extensions, and the only way for me now to work is using the classic Microsoft authentication and I can't rely on that because it's going to disappear in the future.

Is there any way to force a "browser login" or login with device code with the new authentication method? If not, could it be added before removing the "classic" option?

title: SCM - Binary File Diff does not show in Combined Working Diff, Combined Staged Diff or Commit Diff
description: ### Correct observation: Binary Files show as added, renamed, changed or deleted in the working tree diff and the staged diff if each individual binary file is _**viewed separately.**_ ### Incorrect observation and Problem: Binary Files do not show **at all** in the combined working tree diff, combined staged changes diff or in the commit diff. If such a diff has **_only_** binary file changes, the diff shows "No Changed Files" which is incorrect and misleading. ### Steps to Reproduce: 1. Add, rename, change or delete a binary file (such as an image). 2. View the working tree changes as a combined diff by clicking "Open Changes" button in "Source Control" pane. 3. Stage the changes. 4. View the staged changes as a combined diff by clicking "Open Staged Changes" button in "Source Control" pane. 5. Commit the changes. 6. View the diff of the commit by clicking on it in the "Source Control Graph" pane. **Note:** Steps 2, 4 and 6 show the same problem in various states. ### Additional information: **Sample Repository to test with:** https://github.com/ADTC/vscode-binary-diff-sample-repo/commits/main/ ```sh git clone https://github.com/ADTC/vscode-binary-diff-sample-repo.git cd vscode-binary-diff-sample-repo code . ``` Tip: [You can grab some sample images here.](https://github.com/yavuzceliker/sample-images/tree/main/images) **Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?:** Yes (I confirm that I tried it with `code --disable-extensions` and the problem persists.) **System Information:** ```yaml Version: 1.97.0 Commit: 33fc5a94a3f99ebe7087e8fe79fbe1d37a251016 Date: 2025-02-04T22:41:26.688Z (5 days ago) Electron: 32.2.7 ElectronBuildId: 10660205 Chromium: 128.0.6613.186 Node.js: 20.18.1 V8: 12.8.374.38-electron.0 OS: Darwin arm64 23.6.0 ```

- VS Code Version: 1.97.0 (33fc5a9), Electron 32.2.7 (10660205)
- OS Version: Darwin arm64 23.5.0 (macOS 14.5)

Steps to Reproduce:
- Install `pwsh` via homebrew.
- Run `chsh -s /opt/homebrew/opt/powershell/bin/pwsh`.
- Install VS Code and launch from the dock (NOT from command line).
- Notification in the bottom right: "Unable to resolve your shell environment: Unexpected exit code from spawned shell (code 1, signal null)"

title: ctrl+hover preview disappears instantly
description:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. hold ctrl then hover over a definition

Expected:
Hover pops up

Actual:
Hover doesn't pop up or only pops up for a single frame

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/73df7ca3-e253-411c-ae0b-88a6de25e2b4

```js
function abc() { }

abc();
```

also notice that giving focus to another window fixes it (when the main window is out of focus)

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

- VS Code Version: 1.97.0 and [insiders](https://insiders.vscode.dev/)
- OS Version: Windows 11

title: Reenable plzdedicatedworker
description: Follow-up to https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/233060

title: Import Profile feature does not finishes the process (looping)
description: Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes/No - VS Code Version: 1.97.0 - OS Version: macOS Sequoia Hi, I was organizing my profiles, between Stable and Insiders release installations, and when I tried to import one to another, the Import process wasn't actually finishing, resulting in an loop experience. Steps to Reproduce: 1. Export a profile from VS Code Insiders 2. Import a profile to VS Code 3. Click `Create` 4. You can see the progress / toast saying it is _installing extensions..._ 5. The progress / toast finishes 6. The `Create` button remains enabled and the _unsaved profile_ indicators also remains there. 8. Click to close the profile and a modal window (to save profile changes) is show, even without changing anything after importing the profile 10. Click `save` 11. The same progress / toast appears, installing extensions for the profile 12. The progress / toast finishes 13. But the `Create` button remains 14. You notice the loopI have tried the same process a few times, closing and reopening VS Code, and at some time, the profile appeared, even without the saving/importing process finishing with success Thanks in advance

title: Terminal suggest: fig generator completions often complain about the executable not existing
description: Eg. `npm global remove |` will fail with npm ENOENT

title: Terminal suggest: Refresh global commands after content in bin changes
description:
Repro:

1. Open terminal, check completions for an npm package's cli that isn't installed, like `pnpm`
2. Install it: `npm install -g pnpm@latest-10`
3. Try get completions for `pnpm`, 🐛 it won't work until the window is reloaded due to our cache's lifetime

title: WATCH Unexpected COPY / PASTE behaviour
description: Type: Bug I'm using the build in debugger for python in visual studio code. For years I'm able to CTRL + C the expression from the WATCH stack. Since the last update. it doesn't copy the expression,... but it copies the value. When right clicking on the expression, there is no option to copy the expression. Only to copy the value. What I would like to see, is CTRL + C copies the expression. Right click > Copy Value, would copy the value of the expression. VS Code version: Code 1.97.0 (33fc5a94a3f99ebe7087e8fe79fbe1d37a251016, 2025-02-04T22:41:26.688Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.22631 ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6afd04eb-9936-4729-a6fa-1e7edd8755c8)

title: Terminal in editor tab shows `$(loading~spin)` when running program
description:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: 1.97.0 (I don't think this is a regression.)
- OS Version: Linux.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open an integrated terminal.
2. Move terminal into editor area.
3. Run a continuously running program. For a simple example, just run `node` to launch a REPL.
4. Terminal in editor tab shows as below:  
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/99f66e69-eacb-4e04-ac8b-b869f75f7fcc)

Editor tab won't substitute the `$(loading~spin)` variable with actual spin, so this variable should be removed when moving a terminal into editor area. Or, let editor tab support rendering a spin.

title: folded markdown cell will show the preview when the file reopened but the cell is still folded
description:
### Applies To

- [x] Notebooks (.ipynb files)
- [ ] Interactive Window and\/or Cell Scripts (.py files with \#%% markers)

### What happened?

1. fold a markdown cell and close vscode
2. open the vscode with the notebook
3. the folded markdown cell show the preview automatically and the preview overlap with other texts

Steps to Reproduce:

4. Open launch.json from folder b

Actual behavior:

Expected behavior:

Add launch config to file which is open! Not the other file

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Turn on NVDA.

6. "Get started with .Net MAUI" screen will be disaplayed
7. Tab to "Connect account to C# Dev Kit" and Tab to connect and press enter
8. Tab to "Set up your .Net environment" and Tab to Install .NET SDK and
9. Tab to "Set up your .Net MAUI environment" and Tab to "Open a Terminal" control
10. Tab to "Create your .NET MAUI App" and Tab to Build, Launch and Debug
11. Tab to "Launch Your .NET MAUI" app
12. Verify that No name is provided for "Launch Your .NET MAUI" Checkbox.

Note: This is an accessibility bug that was assigned to the VSCX Platform Tools team regarding the VSCode extension for .NET MAUI. It was determined that the issue is not within the extension, but VSCode itself.

title: PR Diff View Showing False Differences for Windows-1252 Encoded Files
description:
We have a repository with files using **Windows-1252** encoding. To ensure VSCode loads the correct encoding, we added the following configuration:

```json
{
    "[c]": {
        "files.encoding": "windows1252"
    },
    "files.associations": {
        "*.h": "c"
    }
}
```

When viewing the diff of a file encoded in **Windows-1252**, the diff view incorrectly highlights differences on lines containing special characters, even though no actual changes exist in the PR.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/dca90db4-1954-481e-9dc1-5d353e9cd817)

However, when using **GitLens Compare**, the same lines are not marked as different and are correctly displayed as unchanged.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cb2d974d-1434-46b1-a6a3-f09f40937f93)

This makes reviewing a PR that modifies Windows-1252 encoded files very difficult, as many unrelated changes will appear in the diff view.

<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill some of these. -->

- Extension version: 0.102.0
- VSCode Version: 1.96.4
- OS: Windows 11 24H2
- Repository Clone Configuration (single repository/fork of an upstream repository): N/A
- Github Product (Github.com/Github Enterprise version x.x.x): N/A

title: Problems with quick info hint in 1.96+
description:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: 1.96+
- OS Version: Ubuntu 20.04 (Gnome 3.36), Ubuntu 24.04 (Gnome 46)

Steps to Reproduce:
Prerequisite: Text Editor > Hover: Enabled is disabled in the settings

When calling a hint with quick information (CTRL+Q with Intellij Keybindings, or CTRL+K CTRL+I), it used to be possible to press ESC immediately to hide the hint. In versions older than 1.95.3, you must first select this prompt with the mouse, after which you can hide it by ESC.

The latest version where this problem does not exist is 1.95.3.

If you enable Text Editor > Hover: Enabled, the function works as expected: the hint is displayed in manual mode and it is hidden by ESC.

title: Microsoft auth window opens behind Edge browser window
description:
Testing #238147 

I'm on Windows 11 with my default browser set to Edge.

1. Run `code-tunnel-insiders serve-web` from the integrated terminal in VS Code Insiders.
2. Click on the localhost link to open an instance of VS Code Web on Edge.
3. Turn on Settings Sync.
4. When prompted to log in, choose to log in with a Microsoft account.
5. :bug: The login window appears behind the browser window.

This bug might be on the browser level, but I'm writing it down anyway for reference.

title: Editor GPU causes code overlap with line # toggle in notebook cells
description:
repro (inconsistent as to which state you end up in, but bugs appear very consistently in some manner)

- have `editor.experimentalGpuAcceleration` on
- open a notebook with a code cell
- using cell toolbar or other UI/setting, enable line numbers (easiest is to focus the cell container and hit L)
- see overlap of line numbers w/ code

notes:
- sometimes the editor reacts and shifts code to the right, however if you undo the line numbers, it remains stuck out right and has a huge margin of empty space left. 
- can get into a state where some lines shift with the line numbers and some don't

ETA: Tried on a newer Fedora, same result with 1.96.4.

title: Inconsistent and confusing display of newlines in file paths
description:
Type: Bug Steps to Reproduce: 1. Use Linux 2. Create a new directory 3. Open the directory in VS code 4. With a terminal in the newly created directory, create a new file with a newline in its name. For example with `touch 'newline_file.txt'`. 5. Look at the file in Explorer. It will show as `newline_`. The remainder of the name is hidden. 6. Hover over the file in Explorer. It will now show the full file name over two lines. 7. Open the file in Explorer by clicking at it once. It will now display as `newline_file.txt` in the tab view at the top. That is, there is no indication that there's a newline in there. 8. Hover over the file name tab. Ensure that the file doesn't have the "Keep open" property, i.e. the title in the tab needs to be cursive. It will show its name over three lines for some reason, as: ```txt path/to/file/newline_ file.txt ``` Expected behavior: - Consistent behavior - File names with newlines are not cut off - No double newline when showing a file name with one newline - Perhaps that file names would always show on one line, for simplicity. With some special indicator to show that it's a newline there. This may seem like a weird use case, and it kind of is, but I was writing test code to see if my application would behave weirdly with file paths with newlines and I noticed that VS code did, perhaps unsurprisingly. title: thread 'main' panicked at src/bin/code/main.rs:47:14:..(openssl.cnf incompatibility with system)
description:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes/No

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: Irrelevant
- OS Version:  Linux, openssl 3.x or later

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install an openSSL provider as a loadable module in the remote system 
2. vscode remote calls "code-<hash>"
3. this binary panics 
```
`thread 'main' panicked at src/bin/code/main.rs:47:14:
called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: reqwest::Error { kind: Builder, source: Normal(ErrorStack([Error { code: 50856204, library: "digital envelope routines", function: "inner_evp_generic_fetch", reason: "unsupported", file: "../src/nssl-3.1.4-c5488d00d9.clean/crypto/evp/evp_fetch.c", line: 341, data: "Global default library context, Algorithm (OS-DRBG : 0), Properties (<null>)" }, Error { code: 301990032, library: "random number generator", function: "rand_new_drbg", reason: "unable to fetch drbg", file: "../src/nssl-3.1.4-c5488d00d9.clean/crypto/rand/rand_lib.c", line: 647 }, Error { code: 50856204, library: "digital envelope routines", function: "inner_evp_generic_fetch", reason: "unsupported", file: "../src/nssl-3.1.4-c5488d00d9.clean/crypto/evp/evp_fetch.c", line: 341, data: "Global default library context, Algorithm (OS-DRBG : 0), Properties (<null>)" }, Error { code: 301990032, library: "random number generator", function: "rand_new_drbg", reason: "unable to fetch drbg", file: "../src/nssl-3.1.4-c5488d00d9.clean/crypto/rand/rand_lib.c", line: 647 }, Error { code: 168558848, library: "SSL routines", function: "SSL_CTX_new_ex", reason: "malloc failure", file: "../src/nssl-3.1.4-c5488d00d9.clean/ssl/ssl_lib.c", line: 3407 }])) }
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace`
```

You can't have it both ways, if you decide for whatever reason to link openssl statically like it currently is in the "code" executable you MUST NOT attempt to load the operating system configuration openssl.cnf or similar. it might not be compatible, 
I cannot find where to exactly override the environment just for this binary , it is sufficient to setenv OPENSSL_CONF=/dev/null to make the issue go away.

title: Paste widget is confusing and problematic for screen reader users
description:
From @jooyoungseo: 
1. Paste an image in a markdown document
2. Try to access the code actions, `ctrlCmd+.` like the one from the vision extension, to refine alt text.
3. Instead, the paste menu receives focus.
4. Hit `escape`.  Hit `ctrlCmd+.` again to try to access code actions, 🐛  the paste menu is activated.

cc @isidorn 

My suggestion:

Make the paste menu a code action with a submenu for the options, prioritizing it at the top.

title: Long descriptions in merge editor can push the action items off the screen.
description:
- VS Code Version: insiders.vscode.dev
- OS Version: Linux

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Run the `_open.mergeEditor` command with args like:
```json
"base": "file:///vscode/README.md",
"input1": {
    "title": "Lefty left",
    "description": "Very, very long and boring description",
    "uri": "file:///vscode/README.md",
},
"input2": {
    "title": "Righty right",
    "description": "Very, very long and boring description",
    "uri": "file:///vscode/README.md",
},
"output": "file:///vscode/README.md"
```
2. Scale or in some other way make on of the columns small.


As the editor header gets smaller, the title, desctiption and toolbar all refuse the shrink `flex-shrink: 0`, and as such the actions get pushed off the screen:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/85c0b6e3-1d91-4802-bf81-810f989da4b9)

Full screenshot:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7c3284ea-812f-408d-ad96-0e65f09e9f00)

If you shrink the view any further, then the actions are not visible at all.


---


I think that the actions should always be visible. What is interesting is that in the results header at the button, which has more space by default, `.description` is allowed to shrink.

https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/db8e3d291301dbde1c40221203e5e4255d9fdbec/src/vs/workbench/contrib/mergeEditor/browser/view/media/mergeEditor.css#L36

But a few lines up for non result editors, it is not allowed to shrink.

https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/db8e3d291301dbde1c40221203e5e4255d9fdbec/src/vs/workbench/contrib/mergeEditor/browser/view/media/mergeEditor.css#L27


There is also `.detail` and `.title` which are never allowed to shrink.


A small work around would be to allow `.description` to shrink. I think that is the most common field to contain longer descriptions.

Another option would be to nest the three text fields in a child element as a sibling to .toolbar. Then we can control how they grow/shrink relative to each other, but force the parent contrainer to shrink to make space for the actions.


---


The real word issue that we see with this is that we are trying to use the description field in a merge control to show the short first line commit messages to help users see exactly what which side of the conflict is. We are happy for these messages to be cut short, but what is currently happening is that the long messages are pushing the action off the screen.

title: Visual Studio Code doesn't show translated walkthrough strings until restarting app or reloading window
description:
Type: Bug 1. Select "Configure Display Language" from comand palette and choose e.g. "spanish (es)" 2. Restart application Observe that application menus and UI is in spanish as selected 3. Go to extension marketplace and install a localized extension, e.g. ms-vscode.cpptools [defined in this repo](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-cpptools/tree/main/Extension) 4. Open extension walkthrough in welcome page. Walkthrough steps will be in english and not spanish, although markdown content in side-panel will in fact be in spanish. 5. select "Developer: Reload Window" from comand palette Walkthrough steps will now be in spanish, as expected I'm using version 1.96.4, but this same issue repros in latest insider build. title: Terminal resizing/repainting issue when using Zellij
description:
Type: Bug I use Zellij to maintain persistent sessions for my Remote-SSH connections to a Linux host from a Windows laptop. I filed https://github.com/zellij-org/zellij/issues/3568 thinking it was a Zellij issue, but according to the developer it might be an issue with how VSCode triggers SIGWINCH and sets TIOCSWINSZ. title: Discard button in Copilot is not displayed in inline chat
description:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->

<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: It's related to GitHub Copilot extension

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: 1.97.0-insider (user setup)
Commit: 3250a26dfecc06defce495f1e16b80681974c62b
Date: 2025-01-29T05:04:50.952Z
Electron: 32.2.7
ElectronBuildId: 10660205
Chromium: 128.0.6613.186
Node.js: 20.18.1
V8: 12.8.374.38-electron.0
OS: Windows_NT x64 10.0.26100
- OS Version: Windows 11

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install GitHub Copilot extension in VSCode Insiders
2. Open any file
3. Open inline chat
4. Ask something

There should be `Discard` button (unless it has been removed intentionally).
In stable version it's displayed correctly.

~Also it looks like that code block is not formatted.~ - It seems that it has been fixed in new released version (Commit: 63c0355e5bc04b124b8600ce42fe30c73b7a5a5e) but unfortunately `Discard` button is still not displayed.

Screenshot below, left 1.97.0-insider, right stable version 1.96.4

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/747f0004-4977-4869-a717-0e2b032249f7)

In both cases the same GitHub Copilot extension pre-release version is installed (1.260.1341).

title: Enabling `window.titleBarStyle` on linux and closing window triggers ubuntu crash reporter
description: Testing #238839 On ubuntu x64 ``` josh@aslan-ubuntu24-desktop:~$ cat /etc/os-release PRETTY_NAME="Ubuntu 24.04.1 LTS" NAME="Ubuntu" VERSION_ID="24.04" VERSION="24.04.1 LTS (Noble Numbat)" VERSION_CODENAME=noble ID=ubuntu ID_LIKE=debian HOME_URL="https://www.ubuntu.com/" SUPPORT_URL="https://help.ubuntu.com/" BUG_REPORT_URL="https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/" PRIVACY_POLICY_URL="https://www.ubuntu.com/legal/terms-and-policies/privacy-policy" UBUNTU_CODENAME=noble LOGO=ubuntu-logo ``` 1. Open code exploration 2. Set setting `"window.titleBarStyle": "native"` 3. VS Code will detect that its needs to restart and a dialog will pop up 4. Click restart button 5. 🐛 The ubuntu issue reporter will detect this quit as a crash Note that upon re-opening code-exploration the setting seemed to be successfully set and things were working as expected This is the crash report that I recovered from `/var/crash`. Not sure if you can make any sense of it (added .txt extension to permit upload): [_usr_share_code-exploration_code-exploration.1000.crash.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18580671/_usr_share_code-exploration_code-exploration.1000.crash.txt)

title: Delay to scroll to bottom when auto-scroll is enabled
description:
Testing #238846

Steps:
* Open Window Output Channel
* Make sure log level is Trace
* In the filter, uncheck all categories (Cloud Changes, Network, Views, Window). Uncheck all of them.
* Turn on Auto Scrolling if it's not already on
* Now go back to the filter and check Window
* :bug: the view starts with the scroll bar all the way up at the top, but then after a second it scrolls down to the bottom

Video:

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/33a8b87e-19c4-4a46-85aa-7ca2b0f858f8

Interestingly, if you turn auto-scrolling off, then there is no delay.

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes/No

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->

Version: 1.96.3 (user setup)
Commit: 91fbdddc47bc9c09064bf7acf133d22631cbf083
Date: 2025-01-09T18:14:09.060Z
Electron: 32.2.6
ElectronBuildId: 10629634
Chromium: 128.0.6613.186
Node.js: 20.18.1
V8: 12.8.374.38-electron.0
OS: Windows_NT x64 10.0.19045

The order of configuration items in an extension's settings is not respected when a search is done in the settings panel.

In the table of contents in Settings, if you click on an extension (or expand the extension and choose one of its setting's categories), then the order will be correct. However, if you do a search for the extension name, then the settings are shown in the incorrect order. In this scenario they aren't even shown in proper lexicographic (alphabetical) order.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open settings
2. Search for the name of an extension
3. Observe that the order of the configuration items is not the same as as the order you would see if you DID NOT search, and had simply clicked on the extension name in the table of contents,. When searching, the order does not follow what is defined in the extension's package.json file.

In the screenshots, the name of the extension is "AtomicViz" and the search is done for the string "atomicviz". So the search results should be properly ordered.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/243bb639-7a18-49ec-8260-198858c417f5)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/51acc420-00ee-425c-b85a-65d6af71e991)

title: Diff viewer: misaligned lines with inlays + word wrap
description:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes/No
Yes
<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: 1.96.4
- OS Version: Windows 11

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Make a code change in a reasonably long file, in a language that has inlay hints, so there's a diff
2. Open the diff viewer, ensure word wrap is enabled (<kbd>Alt</kbd><kbd>Z</kbd>), and scroll around throughout the file
3. Watch as the lines get misaligned between the added and removed side
4. Use <kbd>Ctrl</kbd><kbd>Alt</kbd> (with `editor.inlayHints.enabled` set to `onUnlessPressed`) to temporarily hide the inlays and notice how they also get misaligned

Video of the bug in action:

[Video (70 seconds)](https://files.keavon.com/-/HarshAcclaimedEuropeanfiresalamander/capture_40_.mp4), showing both the scrolling-caused misalignment and triggering it with toggling inlays.

Description:

This is an issue that has frustrated my many times a day for years, so I'm finally filling an issue for it.

The diff editor is meant to keep your left (removals) and right (additions) side's lines aligned. But scrolling throughout the code file, or turning on/off inlay hints, causes a misalignment to occur and persist. The result is that the red removals and green additions for a line can be considerably misaligned.

This happens under the conditions that word wrap is enabled (so a line of code may wrap across multiple displayed lines on the left, right, or both sides) and inlays are enabled (so the width of a line of code may become elongated).

My theory is that scrolling within the document causes the LSP to generate more inlays within the newly viewed areas, changing the line widths which changes the wrapping which changes the number of wrapped lines occupied by one line of code; and it does so differently on the right from the left, since the LSP generates no inlays for the left side.

The workaround for this is to either type something to make it recalculate, or briefly toggle word wrap by tapping <kbd>Alt</kbd><kbd>Z</kbd> twice. But a proper fix for this bug would be a real quality of life improvement.

Version: 1.97.0-insider (user setup)
Commit: cc14c75c962284dfd2e2493dd487e3b81fb15d23
Date: 2025-01-23T10:37:55.126Z
Electron: 32.2.7
ElectronBuildId: 10660205
Chromium: 128.0.6613.186
Node.js: 20.18.1
V8: 12.8.374.38-electron.0
OS: Windows_NT x64 10.0.26100

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Clone https://github.com/jakebailey/vscode-getreport-issue
2. Run the extension
3. Run the "Hello World" command
4. Attempt to do anything with the editor

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8204f381-14e1-4088-bb33-74208c27ee9f)

I discovered this as part of https://github.com/dprint/dprint-vscode/pull/99; for months my editor has been unresponsive at startup, unable to hover or even copy and paste now that there are paste providers, and this particular call is the culprit.

If I run Node directly, or call VS Code "as node", it does not exhibit these problems. My impression is that this has to do with VS Code patching all of the networking calls, since unfortunately `getReport` calls to the network (even though effectively all users use it to check if libc is musl or not).

Related: https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/55576

title: Debugger shows incorrect thread state if "continued" arrives too soon after a "stopped" (or "started"?)
Braces colouring is off inside Dart multiline strings
description:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: 1.96.4
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.22631

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open an empty folder with nothing inside
2. Disable all extensions
3. Add a new `file.dart` file
4. Write the following to it:

```dart
var myString = '''
Here is a string with ()
and some other examples {like (this)}.
''';
```

5. See the braces colouring (possibly, more on that later)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/87fbf68b-4dbb-43b0-bbba-f070e35ceab5)

6. Change the string to be raw by adding `r` before the opening `'''`:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b70b8bbc-ad07-43a8-8eee-a2216a434a4f)

I've asked @DanTup to verify this but with the same VS Code version he could not see this behaviour on his machine. 

If I close the editor (file opened) and reopen it (even removing `r` now) I see the braces colouring flash and go back to string colour.

His guess is that there may be some other racing here as https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/230498. Same machine, a Samsung Galaxy Book Pro. To note we had problems with this colouring previously at https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/209435 for Dart and we still have this opened for Python https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/225179.

I can't reliably reproduce this (besides flashing) again on this _exact_ folder/file (unfortunatelly). But I saw this behaviour previously on Dart projects and this is an empty folder with only that file inside.

title: `vscode.workspace.fs.copy` does not copy folders properly on github.dev
description:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: github.dev
- OS Version: Windows 11 24H2

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Have an extension with the following code be run on github.dev:
```ts
// copy `lib` folder from `assets/initial-project` from extension files to the root of current workspace

const initDir = vscode.Uri.joinPath(
    context.extensionUri,
    "assets/initial-project"
);

const workspaceUri = vscode.workspace.workspaceFolders?.[0]?.uri!;

await vscode.workspace.fs.copy(
    vscode.Uri.joinPath(initDir, "lib"),
    vscode.Uri.joinPath(workspaceUri, "lib")
);
```
2. The file gets created with json listing of folder's contents. 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8593b134-6f83-4406-9d42-d8a21712a3be)

NOTE: The folder is copied properly when run on VSCode desktop and vscode.dev with local filesystem.

Here is the [URL of the folder](https://glebbash.vscode-unpkg.net/glebbash/lo/0.0.57/extension/assets/initial-project/lib) from my extension, I guess the fix is to somehow detect that this is a folder and not a file in github.dev file system provider.

title: macOS titlebar/windowTitle cuts large paths
description:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
macOS native titlebar missing a lot of available space and so paths are often cut

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d8d677db-d3b8-4933-a548-66e751cd6b97)

By default this titlebar only has like the 50% of the full available window space, and the path is usually trim in large paths or paths that also states we are inside a container like in this screenshot.
This should be a configurable option, allowing the user to set up a larger titleBar from 50% to 100% (all available space except the other controls at the very left/right of the window.

title: Format on save is aborted when interacting with the editor
description:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->

## Steps to Reproduce

1. Install a formatter that takes a significant amount of time for large files (for example [YAPF](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=eeyore.yapf) for Python). Note while this might require the installation of an extension, the bug is still located within the code of VS Code. With a large enough file, you can probably reproduce this with VS Code's built-in formatters as well.
2. Set `"editor.formatOnSave": true` in the settings of VS Code.
3. Open a large file so that formatting takes long enough (for YAPF, any Python file with more than 1000 lines will do).
4. Make some changes to the file make the file unformatted.
5. Save.
6. Wait until the `Saving '[...]': Running Code Actions and Formatters...` message is displayed in the status bar and the `Running '[...]' Formatter` notification is shown.
7. Before the formatter finishes and VS Code saves the formatted file, do any of the following:
   * Click anywhere in the editor so that the position of the caret is changed.
   * Press any of the four arrow keys.
   * Change the active file in the editor by clicking on another editor tab.

## Expected Behavior

The file is formatted and saved as soon as the formatter finishes.

## Actual Behavior

The file is neither formatted nor saved, even if waiting long enough. This is also indicated by the status bar message and notification immediately vanishing when performing any of the actions in step 7 above.

## Additional Information

- VS Code Version: 1.96.3
- OS Version: Windows 11
- This issue was originally included in #238044, but has been moved to separate feature request from bug report.

title: NativeEditContext advertises focus for off-dom editor
description: I have a situation in which I have a blinking cursor in an editor but it doesn't accept backspace, e.g the `deleteLeft` command isn't executed. I was able to debug this and I can see that the wrong editor is selected and that happens because an off-dom editor is saying it has focus.

title: Color of tab name for modified file reverts to default color if a problem is detected
description:
- VS Code Version: 1.96.3
- OS Version: Windows 11

Steps to Reproduce:
1. With VSCode and GitLens enabled, open a project linked to a git repository 
2. Modify a file locally. The tab name should appear in orange:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7339d2a1-8410-4186-b621-44ff09e03ef4)

3. Generate a warning in the file, such as an unused function. The tab name reverts to default color:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2f802d42-a2c2-4a75-995a-a384844b9139)

Expected behavior:
The tab name should stay in orange as long as it's modified locally.

OS: Windows_NT x64 10.0.26100
- OS Version: Windows 11

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Set `Git: Autofetch` to `true`
2. Set `Git: Autofetch period` to `1`
3. Click on `Source Control` icon
4. Click on any entry on Source Control Graph
5. Look at the Source control icon

It blinks every few seconds.
It doesn't blink until entry on Source Control Graph is clicked.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2206b7f0-4adf-451d-9cce-edda0a0f9bc3

It's similar to https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/219877 but with additional steps to reproduce.

title: Tooltip for Close Button in Dialog Box is Obscured by the Dialog Itself
description: ## Title: Tooltip for Close Button in Dialog Box is Obscured by the Dialog Itself This issue affects the usability of the dialog box, as users cannot see the tooltip for the close button, which may lead to confusion or difficulty in closing the dialog. ## Steps to Reproduce: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3ed6c046-095f-4cbd-af74-bd2e4d442393) 1. Perform an action in VS Code that triggers a dialog box to appear. 2. Hover the mouse over the close button (typically the 'X' in the top-right corner) of the dialog box. 3. Observe that the tooltip for the close button is displayed but is obscured by the dialog box itself. ## Expected Behavior: The tooltip should be displayed above or outside the dialog box, ensuring it is fully visible to the user. ## Actual Behavior: The tooltip is rendered behind the dialog box, making it partially or completely invisible. ## Additional Information: - **Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?**: Yes I also conducted tests using the latest codebase of the VS Code project, and the aforementioned bug can be reproduced as well. - **VS Code Version**: - Version: 1.96.2 (system setup) - Commit: fabdb6a30b49f79a7aba0f2ad9df9b399473380f - Date: 2024-12-19T10:22:47.216Z - Electron: 32.2.6 - ElectronBuildId: 10629634 - Chromium: 128.0.6613.186 - Node.js: 20.18.1 - V8: 12.8.374.38-electron.0 - OS: Windows_NT x64 10.0.26100 ## OS Version: Windows 11 24H2

title: Luminosity contrast ratio of keyboard focus indicator on Authorize button fails to meet the required ratio of 3:1: A11y_VS Code extension for API Center_Generate HTTP file_Authorize_Non Text Contrast.
description:
### GitHub Tags
#A11yTCS; #A11ySev2; #Win32; #WCAG1.4.11; #GH_VSCodeextensionforAPICenter_Win32_Apr2024; #DesktopApp; #Visual Studio Code Client; #A11yMAS; #NonText Contrast; #A11YWCAG2.1; 

### Environment Details:
Application Name: VS Code Extension for API Center
OS: Windows 11 Enterprise 23H2 (OS build 22631.3296)

### Repro Steps:

1. Create an API center in azure portal.
2. Open Visual studio Code.
3. Tab till API center extension in the left side panel and press enter.
4. Tab till definition under the Api name which you have created, and press enter.
5. The name which you have provided to the definition will appear for ex-"openapi4", right click on it.
6. Go to "Generate HTTP file" using the down arrow and press enter.
7. An HTTP file will appear.
8. Tab till Authorize button.
9. Verify whether the Luminosity contrast ratio of keyboard focus indicator on Authorize button meet the required ratio of 3:1 or not.

### Actual Result:
Luminosity contrast ratio of keyboard focus indicator on Authorize button fails to meet the required ratio of 3:1
Note: This issue is observed throughout the feature.

### Expected Result:
Luminosity contrast ratio of visual focus indicator on authorize button should be greater than or equal to required ratio of 3:1.

### User Impact:
People with low vision often have difficulty perceiving tab focus that have insufficient contrast if Luminosity contrast ratio of visual focus indicator fails to meet the required ratio of 3:1. This can be exacerbated if the person has a color vision deficiency that lowers the contrast even further. Providing a lightness difference of 3:1 or greater can make these items more distinguishable when the person does not see a full range of colors

### Attachment:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b9a042a6-3318-40cb-86e0-b74d7f1d772d)

title: Git - VS Code's git commit error pop-up shows wrong hook failure
description:
Type: Bug Description: It seems when performing a git commit from the VS Code UI and there is a commit failure (e.x., in a git-hook) the error pop-up only shows only the first line of the output which is not necessarily the error. Steps to Reproduce: Perform a git commit from the VS Code UI so that you get a warning followed by an error. I'd expect to see the error message in the pop-up but instead the unrelated warning message shows which can be misleading. Steps to Reproduce (Specific): 1. `lint-stages` issuing a warning "No staged files match any configured task" (which passes gracefully) 2. then there is an error from `commitlint` about a bad commit message. More Details: ![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ad257a07-9a2a-4892-bdc8-49a5ad074be2) raw commit output: ``` filepath> git commit -m "foo: this will fail" → No staged files match any configured task. ⧗ input: foo: this will fail ✖ type must be one of [build, chore, ci, docs, feat, fix, perf, refactor, revert, style, test] [type-enum] ✖ found 1 problems, 0 warnings ⓘ Get help: https://github.com/conventional-changelog/commitlint/#what-is-commitlint husky - commit-msg hook exited with code 1 (error) ``` I'd like for the popup to read the actual error: "input: foo: this will fail, type must be one of [build, chore, ci, docs, feat, fix, perf, refactor, revert, style, test] [type-enum]". Instead it shows the first line of output: "No staged files match any configured task." which is misleading since that's not the error. This poster is having the same issue. How to fix Microsoft Visual studio code, language pack issue from English to French at first launch.
description:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->

We are facing issue regarding the Microsoft Visual studio code --language pack, so we need to change the display language of the software to French(FR), so as per information provided on visual studio code page, we downloaded the language pack and also edited the argv.json file but even Tho keeping this files and folders priorly after installation, still at first launch we are getting English language only. Please refer attached image 1

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5f850a4f-9c2e-4081-9ba6-34ff5b6f1a7e)

. As we are getting French language at 2nd launch(Refer image 2),

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/29faeab3-4274-44e1-aed8-f04a5905a8f4)
we also tried to add start process of code.exe and killed it so it gets launched at once into the script. but still even after keeping user data files, language package and also start process and kill through script still English language gets displayed.

Summary: On first launch we are getting English language even after keeping all the needed data in user context, but after closing the software and relaunch it manually then only it displays French lang. Not of first launch. Please help us understand if any additional parameters files to be added to make it work on first launch.

title: File Comparison Scrollbar Indicators Render in Wrong Relative Position When Spanning 2 Monitors
description:
Type: Bug Select and compare 2 files, as normal, by right-clicking on each, in turn, and selecting those appropriate options. The new comparison tab opens with the visual diff of the 2 files. Because my primary monitor (1920x1080) isn't wide/large enough to fully see the contents of both files, even with the Explorer pane dismissed, I take VSCode's application window out of 'maximized'/fullscreen mode and then drag the right edge of the application window across into my secondary monitor's (1920x1080) space, until the application window is wide enough to fully see both files. The scrollbar has what I'll call an overlay to indicate the diffs as red and green in their relative positions in their respective files. But, when I arrange the application window this way, the red/green diff overlay appears as a floating column in the middle of the right side of the comparison tab. It's almost as if it's encountered a max-width contraint preventing it from rendering in the correct horizontal position. ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a448bddf-849c-4aa2-bb14-07784ff137e6) VS Code version: Code 1.88.1 (e170252f762678dec6ca2cc69aba1570769a5d39, 2024-04-10T17:41:02.734Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.22631 (side note: My laptop's OS is definitely Windows11, working on a remote server) Modes: Remote OS version: Linux x64 5.14.21-150500.55.68-default Remote OS version: Linux x64 4.12.14-122.234-default

title: Editor GPU: Double rendering after undo
description:
Repro:

1. Enable editor gpu rendering, reload window
2. Go to this line in vscode: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/77027e72e5f497e72edeba40aa9360a0865eec08/extensions/terminal-suggest/src/terminalSuggestMain.ts#L243-L247
3. Delete that function
4. Undo, 🐛 bad render

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/da017ff5-3dd9-42e1-bf9c-969e7d2c10da)

title: Sometimes run recent command in terminal will not set the terminal to the very bottom
description:
Repro:

1. Open a terminal
2. Run `ls` to fill viewport
3. Press ctrl+alt+r to open run recent command (shell integration must be set up and working)
4. Run a command, the terminal scrolls down but sometimes 🐛 doesn't continue scrolling to the output of the just run command

title: Incorrect TerminalShellExecution exit code
description:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes/No

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: 1.94.0
- OS Version: macOS Sonoma 14.4

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Listen for `onDidEndTerminalShellExecution` events
2. Run a command that returns some exit code
3. Type the same command and interrupt with ^C (i.e. interrupt without actually running the command)
4. The exit code reported by the `TerminalShellExecution` event for the second execution (expected to be `undefined` since the command didn't actually run) will be the same as the previous command's exit code

For example:
```bash
$ echo test^C
-> exit code undefined
$ echo test
-> exit code 0
$ echo test^C
-> exit code 0
$ echo test^C
-> exit code 0
$ echo not test^C
-> exit code undefined
$ echo test^C
-> exit code undefined
```

From a quick look, this seems like caused by this code (marked as a hack): https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/3b30f94f4f129e67be9b6c677aac582923da1fab/src/vs/platform/terminal/common/capabilities/commandDetectionCapability.ts#L360-L370

description:
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

Version: 1.96.2 (Universal)
Commit: fabdb6a30b49f79a7aba0f2ad9df9b399473380f
Date: 2024-12-19T10:22:47.216Z
Electron: 32.2.6
ElectronBuildId: 10629634
Chromium: 128.0.6613.186
Node.js: 20.18.1
V8: 12.8.374.38-electron.0
OS: Darwin arm64 24.2.0

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Implement configuration change handler for a configuration value that will update a configuration value dynamically (so that when the user has the user settings window open a configuration value will update)
2. Update a configuration value in the user settings UI that will trigger an update to a setting while the user settings window is opened and focused.

Note that the UI will become stale.  If the UI loses focus it will update but it will not update as long as the UI is focused.

title: Deleting a folder ending in a dot, actually deletes a different folder
description:
Type: Bug I accidentally created a folder ending with a dot, say `src/app/folder.`, when the directory `src/app/folder` (without a trailing dot) also existed. The folder ending with a dot was an accident, so I tried to delete it. However, when deleting the folder `src/app/folder.` in the GUI, VSCode actually deletes the different folder `src/app/folder`! While other software (Including Microsoft Windows Explorer) also have trouble deleting folders ending with dots, I think it is good if VSCode also takes this into account. Despite a folder ending in a dot being a possible illegal path, the fact that these folders can be created and can exist, I think that VSCode should check for these situations to prevent deleting a different folder from the one selected. For me it caused me to lose some uncommitted progress. In this case, how the folder was created does not matter for the issue VSCode is having, but you can read more about that on [the Issue I created for Angular-CLI](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/29275). I hope this helps! VS Code version: Code 1.96.2 (fabdb6a30b49f79a7aba0f2ad9df9b399473380f, 2024-12-19T10:22:47.216Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.19045 Modes:
